alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 8:44AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON HST TODAY FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until noon HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 842 AM HST, radar indicated nearly stationary heavy rain persisting over the lower slopes of windward Haleakala, east of a line from Nahiku to Kaupo. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kipahulu, Kaupo, Hana, Hamoa and Haleakala National Park. This advisory may need to be extended beyond noon HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action.
